instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 No audio devices.
threads.message:
Hi, 820-3115 with liquid damage, does not detect audio devices. No input/output devices found. I can't find out what the problem is. There was serious damage around the U3300, and I had to put in several bridges to power the L6611 and R6610.Maybe something in the layers themselves is hurt!? I'm asking for help.
LG

threads.title: 820-3115 No audio devices.
threads.message:
U330 is not related with audio device; is just power switch for SD Card.

Check for corrosion U6200/01 area.
No audio devices at all on System Report?

threads.title: 820-3115 No audio devices.
threads.message: There is no sound at startup, the system does not detect any audio devices. Power supply feeds 4.5v in on the audio codec chip. To be sure, I replaced the U6200/01. I think everything is present in U6201

threads.title: 820-3115 No audio devices.
threads.message:
I expect some small resistors, or coils corroded.
Check inlcuding for corroded traces.
Check all powers around audio codec and its reset signal too.

threads.title: 820-3115 No audio devices.
threads.message:
I solved the problem - the motherboard is rubbish. 
I found that the connection was broken with U1800-R6211 / HDA_SDIN0. 
Thanks for the help.
